skill.name: query-builder
skill.description: Interactive database query builder for generating optimized SQL and NoSQL queries.
skill.summary: Interactive database query builder for generating optimized SQL and NoSQL queries.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and query examples. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access. The skill provides AI guidance for generating database queries.

content.value_statement: Writing efficient database queries requires deep knowledge of SQL and NoSQL patterns. This skill generates optimized queries with proper parameterization and explains execution strategies for better performance.
actual_capabilities: Generates SQL queries for PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and SQL Server
Creates NoSQL queries for MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, and Cassandra
Writes ORM queries using Prisma, TypeORM, SQLAlchemy, and Mongoose
Explains query execution and performance considerations
Provides parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection
limitations: Does not connect to actual databases or execute queries
Cannot access your database schema without you providing it
Does not provide real-time performance monitoring

prompt_templates.title: Optimization review
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize this query: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE YEAR(created_at) = 2024 AND status = 'active'

output_examples.input: Get all products with their category name where the product is in stock
output: SELECT p.id, p.name, p.price, c.name as category_name
INNER JOIN categories c ON p.category_id = c.id

best_practices: Always use parameterized queries with placeholders like $1 or ? instead of string interpolation
Specify only the columns you need instead of using SELECT *
Add appropriate indexes on columns used in WHERE, JOIN, and ORDER BY clauses
anti_patterns: Using string concatenation to build queries - this creates SQL injection vulnerabilities
Executing queries without LIMIT in production - always paginate large result sets
Using functions on indexed columns in WHERE clauses - this prevents index usage

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, SQL Server, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, and Cassandra with their respective query syntax.

faq.question: What ORMs work with this skill?
faq.answer: Prisma, TypeORM, Sequelize, SQLAlchemy, Django ORM, and Mongoose are all supported with example patterns.

faq.question: Does this skill execute queries?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates query examples. You must copy and run the queries in your own database environment.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only generates text - it cannot access your databases, credentials, or any system resources.

faq.question: How do I get better query suggestions?
faq.answer: Provide your table names, columns, and relationships. Include any specific filters or sorting requirements for optimal results.

faq.question: How is this different from raw SQL generation?
faq.answer: The skill provides both raw SQL and ORM alternatives. ORM versions integrate directly with your code using your existing models.
